info.name: Meraki Webhooks Management
info.description:
A collection of Meraki Dashboard API operations to manage Webhooks and alerts.  
  
Learn more  
[https://meraki.io/webhooks](https://meraki.io/webhooks)

item.name: Alerts
settings
Return the alert configuration for this network

request.description: Return the alert configuration for this network

item.name: Update the alert configuration for this network

request.description:
Update the alert configuration for this network
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
defaultDestinations| object| The network-wide destinations for all alerts on the network.
alerts| array| Alert-specific configuration for each type. Only alerts that pertain to the network can be updated.

item.name: Return the MI alert configuration for this organization

request.description: Return the MI alert configuration for this organization

item.name: Update the MI alert configuration for this organization

request.description:
Update the MI alert configuration for this organization
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
defaultDestinations| object| The org-wide destinations for all alerts on the organization.
alerts| array| Alert-specific configuration for each type. Only alerts that pertain to the whole organization can be updated.
suppression| object| Alert suppression settings details

item.name: profiles
List all MI alert configurations

request.description: List all MI alert configurations

item.name: Create an MI alert configuration

request.description:
Create an MI alert configuration
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
type| string| The alert type
alertCondition| object| conditions of the alert
recipients| array| list of recipients to be notified
networkTags| array| networks with these tags will be monitored for the alert
description| string| user supplied description of the alert

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/alerts/profiles` | create

item.name: Update an MI alert config

request.description:
Update an MI alert config
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
enabled| boolean| Is the alert config enabled
type| string| The alert type
alertCondition| object| conditions of the alert
recipients| array| list of recipients to be notified
networkTags| array| networks with these tags will be monitored for the alert
description| string| user supplied description of the alert

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/alerts/profiles/{alertConfigId}` | create

item.name: Removes an MI alert config

request.description:
Removes an MI alert config
#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/organizations/{organizationId}/alerts/profiles/{alertConfigId}` | destroy

item.name: Http Servers
List The HTTP Servers For A Network

request.description: List the HTTP servers for a network

item.name: Add An HTTP Server To A Network

request.description:
Add an HTTP server to a network
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| A name for easy reference to the HTTP server
url| string| The URL of the HTTP server
sharedSecret| string| A shared secret that will be included in POSTs sent to the HTTP server. This secret can be used to verify that the request was sent by Meraki.
payloadTemplate| object| The payload template to use when posting data to the HTTP server.

item.name: Return An HTTP Server For A Network

request.description: Return an HTTP server for a network

item.name: Update An HTTP Server

request.description:
Update an HTTP server
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| A name for easy reference to the HTTP server
url| string| The URL of the HTTP server
sharedSecret| string| A shared secret that will be included in POSTs sent to the HTTP server. This secret can be used to verify that the request was sent by Meraki.
payloadTemplate| object| The payload template to use when posting data to the HTTP server.

item.name: Delete An HTTP Server From A Network

request.description: Delete an HTTP server from a network

item.name: Payload Templates
List The Webhook Payload Templates For A Network

request.description: List the webhook payload templates for a network

item.name: Create A Webhook Payload Template For A Network

request.description:
Create a webhook payload template for a network
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the new template
body| string| The liquid template used for the body of the webhook message. Either `body` or `bodyFile` must be specified.
headers| string| The liquid template used with the webhook headers.
bodyFile| string| A file containing liquid template used for the body of the webhook message. Either `body` or `bodyFile` must be specified.
headersFile| string| A file containing the liquid template used with the webhook headers.

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/webhooks/payloadTemplates` | create

item.name: Get The Webhook Payload Template For A Network

request.description: Get the webhook payload template for a network

item.name: Destroy A Webhook Payload Template For A Network

request.description: Destroy a webhook payload template for a network. Does not work for included templates ('wpt_00001', 'wpt_00002' or 'wpt_00003')

item.name: Update A Webhook Payload Template For A Network

request.description:
Update a webhook payload template for a network
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
name| string| The name of the template
body| string| The liquid template used for the body of the webhook message.
headers| string| The liquid template used with the webhook headers.
bodyFile| string| A file containing liquid template used for the body of the webhook message.
headersFile| string| A file containing the liquid template used with the webhook headers.

#### Supports Action Batches

**Resource**|**Operation**
:-------------: |:-------------:
`/networks/{networkId}/webhooks/payloadTemplates/{payloadTemplateId}` | update

item.name: Webhook Tests
Send A Test Webhook For A Network

request.description:
Send a test webhook for a network
 #### Body Parameters 
**Parameter**|**Type**|**Description** 
 :-------------: |:-------------: |:-------------: 
url| string| The URL where the test webhook will be sent
sharedSecret| string| The shared secret the test webhook will send. Optional. Defaults to an empty string.
payloadTemplateId| string| The ID of the payload template of the test webhook. Defaults to the HTTP server's template ID if one exists for the given URL, or Generic template ID otherwise
alertTypeId| string| The type of alert which the test webhook will send. Optional. Defaults to power_supply_down.

item.name: Return The Status Of A Webhook Test For A Network

request.description: Return the status of a webhook test for a network

item.name: Alert Types
Return a list of alert types to be used with managing webhook alerts

query.description: Filter sample alerts to a specific product type

request.description: Return a list of alert types to be used with managing webhook alerts

item.name: Logs
Return the log of webhook POSTs sent

query.description: The beginning of the timespan for the data. The maximum lookback period is 90 days from today.
The end of the timespan for the data. t1 can be a maximum of 31 days after t0.

The timespan for which the information will be fetched. If specifying timespan, do not specify parameters t0 and t1. The value must be in seconds and be less than or equal to 31 days. The default is 1 day.
The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 1000. Default is 50.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.
The URL the webhook was sent to

request.description: Return the log of webhook POSTs sent

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.

item.name: List the Organizations

request.description: List the organizations that the user has privileges on

item.name: List the Networks in an Organization

query.description: An optional parameter that is the ID of a config template. Will return all networks bound to that template.
An optional parameter to filter networks by tags. The filtering is case-sensitive. If tags are included, 'tagsFilterType' should also be included (see below).

An optional parameter of value 'withAnyTags' or 'withAllTags' to indicate whether to return networks which contain ANY or ALL of the included tags. If no type is included, 'withAnyTags' will be selected.
The number of entries per page returned. Acceptable range is 3 - 100000. Default is 1000.

A token used by the server to indicate the start of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

A token used by the server to indicate the end of the page. Often this is a timestamp or an ID but it is not limited to those. This parameter should not be defined by client applications. The link for the first, last, prev, or next page in the HTTP Link header should define it.

request.description: List the networks that the user has privileges on in an organization

header.description: A comma-separated list of first, last, prev, and next relative links used for subsequent paginated requests.
